question: 酌み交わす
sourceMnemonic: <ja>酌む</ja> means "to serve" and the kanji <ja>交</ja> means <kanji>mix</kanji>. What happens if you serve and mix together? You're going <vocabulary>to pour each other a drink</vocabulary> because you plan  <vocabulary>to drink together</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
You haven't learned this reading for <ja>交</ja> yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

All the bars are closed so you and your friends are going <vocabuarly>to drink together</vocabulary> in your <reading>ca</reading>r (<ja>か</ja>). You set up a little bar in the back of your car and settle down for some drinks. It's cramped but cosy.
